data.title: ENGLISH â€” MICHAEL RODGERS STUDIO MILAN
data.text:
Michael was born is Scotland and moved to Los Angeles in 1989 where he began his career as a young actor studying with internationallly famous teacher Larry Moss.

He has performed in some of the most well known theatres in the UK and the USA.

Some of the roles for which he has gained critical attention include Rodolfo in A View from a Bridge by Arthur Miller, Bill in The Collection by Harold Pinter, Lvov in Ivanov by Anton Chekov, Joe in Golden Boy by Clifford Odets, Michael in Les Parent Terrible by Jean Cocteau, Christofer in The Milk Train Doesn't Stop Here Anymore and George in Epitaph for George Dillon directed by Larry Moss in New York City.

After studying with Larry Moss for more than 20 years Michael began his career as an acting coach, teacher and director.

His work as a director include Mrs.Dally has a Lover, Dolores, Beast on the Moon, Blues, Speaking In Tongues, Lady of Larkspur Lotion, Dark Room, Rosemary with Ginger and, opening in October, Old Times by Harold Pinter, Clodia and Mrs. Warrensâ€™ Profession by George Bernard Shaw

1. CLASS 1 - TECHNIQUE CLASS

TUESDAY NIGHT

7.30-10.30pm

Start September 5, 2023

This is a class ideal for those who interested in starting a course in acting.

During the course the student will acquire the fundamental techniques that are required to feel autonomous on stage. Stage presence, physical and vocal awareness, emotional and sensorial work script analysis and much more.

This class is geared toward students who have never studied acting and want to clarify their technical skills or for those whom have never studied with Michael.

This class can also be combined with the scene class with the consent of the teacher.

Classes are conducted in English and Italian by Michael Rodgers

2. CLASS 2 - ADVANCED TECHNIQUE

THURSDAY NIGHT

7.30-10.30PM.

Course start: September 6, 2023

This is not a beginner class.

This is the ideal class for those who want to sharpen their technical skills and strengthen their capacity for script analysis.

Using the script the actor will guided on how to unearth the particularities of character, through intense analysis of back story , given circumstances ,social -economic situation and emotional arc of the character.

IN THIS CLASS THE PLAYS OF TENNESSEE WILLIAMS WILL BE REQUIRED FOR ANALYSIS.

Class conducted by Michael Rodgers

3. CLASS 3 - SCENE STUDIO

WEDNESDAY NIGHT

7.30-10.30pm

Course: Wednesday, September 7, 2023

This is a class dedicated to students who already have a knowledge of technique and scene work and are interested in enriching their ability through challenging material. It is a prerequisite that the student has studied scene class for at least one year with Michael Rodgers or has already a strong knowledge of scene work. Class will also involve understanding working infront of the camera for television and film work. Scenes and partners will be assigned by the teacher

Classes are conducted by Michael Rodgers in English and Italian

4. CLASS 4 -ACCENT CLASS

This course is designed to help students/actors perfect English and American accents.

An excellent understanding and knowledge of the English language is required.

These are modules of 10 two-hour classes on a weekly basis.

Participants: 10 people minimum

Mondays from 10 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. or/and Mondays 6:30 p.m. to 8 p.m.

CLASS CONDUCTED BY MICHAEL RODGERS

NOTE

The above classes can be combined after discussion with administration.

At no point can classes be recuperated. Only in cases of serious illness or bereavent or after discussing with administration.

If the teacher cancels for any reason, the classes will be recuperated based on the next availability of the theater.

Courses will follow the school calendar:

National holidays:November 1 - December 8,25 and 26 - April 1 (Easter Monday) -

May 1 -

The school will be closed from Dec. 22 to Jan. 6, 2024 (Christmas holiday)

Classes will begin on September 5, 2023 and end on June 27, 2024

Lessons that fall on the above holidays can not be recuperated

.
